intro: Pogospermum sessiliflorum, commonly known as the sessile-flower pogospermum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically sessile, meaning they lack stalks. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Pogospermum sessiliflorum is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its drought-resistant properties.
